intro: Radermachia rotunda, commonly known as the roundleaf radermachia, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Radermachia rotunda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its compact growth habit and attractive floral display.
